description: Lead the development and management of a number of strategically important service offerings that are crucial for digital humanities work. Design and implement robust, reusable, supported and sustainable technological solutions to support research objectives.
Commissioned by my Digital Humanities professor to conduct research and co-write a paper that is due to be published on Critical Digital Heritage.
This degree draws together teaching from a wide range of disciplines, to investigate the application of computational technologies to the arts, humanities, and cultural heritage.
While studying at University College London, I worked at this bar and occasionally ran the place.

where: School of Oriental and African Studies
description: Wrote a dissertation entitled 'Nexus Narrative: The emergence of a genre' to investigate the impact of the digital technology on the aesthetic usage of language in writing in emerging genres in Chinese digital writing.
Erasmus year at the University of Leipzig (Institut für Anglistik), Germany, September 2009 - September 2010.

where: The Mahindra United World College of India
description: Philosophy, Spanish, English, Biology, Maths, Music
